channel.title: Upgrade whonix template in place
channel.description:
http://qubesosfasa4zl44o4tws22di6kepyzfeqv3tg4e3ztknltfxqrymdad.onion/doc/templates/debian/in-place-upgrade/
Can I upgrade a whonix template in place as it is based on debian?
Also, do I have to do this for every new version? Can't I just keep using `apt upgrade` as a normal debian? I didn't understand why templates needs to be replaced, this consumes a lot of bandwidth and I've been preferring the minimals, which I plan to do for whonix.

item.title: Upgrade whonix template in place
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
nyxnor:

http://qubesosfasa4zl44o4tws22di6kepyzfeqv3tg4e3ztknltfxqrymdad.onion/doc/templates/debian/in-place-upgrade/

Can I upgrade a whonix template in place as it is based on debian?

Whonix is using the same terminology as Debian for it:

Whonix – 17 Jan 22

Release Upgrade

What is a Release Upgrade?

nyxnor:

Also, do I have to do this for every new version?

For major version upgrades such as Whonix 15 to Whonix 16 you either need a release upgrade. See above link.

nyxnor:

Can’t I just keep using apt upgrade as a normal debian?

What is better? Upgrade or Image Re-Installation? See Update vs Image Re-Installation.

nyxnor:

I’ve been preferring the minimals, which I plan to do for whonix.

At time of writing, no minimal templates are available for Qubes-Whonix.

nyxnor:

Also, how to preserve installed packages?

  • Release upgrade: should be preserved.
  • New template installation: needs to be done manually.

Read full topic
